title: No thanks for support mains...
body: Pretty sick of not getting thanks for saving my teams ass every 5 seconds, is this an issue at high elo? or is it just general towards all support mains, we do everything and get no thanks...

replies.body:
Do you thank the assassin every time he gets a kill?

Do you thank your adc for getting farm?

Do you thank your mage for poking them down to give you the advantage before going all in?

No. You don't.

So why should you demand thanks for doing the job you're supposed to do, but not expect to thank the assassin that dives in to kill off the most dangerous person on their team?

As a support you are part of a team, each member of the team has a specific job, and yours is keeping the others alive.
Its what you're expected to do, don't demand thanks for it.

Support is a tricky position, an essential position, but so are the other positions. Supports are always so caught up in thinking:
 _"Im the only one in this team that actually voluntarily goes support, that makes me a better team player, i do more for the team than they do!"_ 
That kind of thinking actually makes them the worst team player, a good team won't expect thanks from anyone, they do the job they are supposed to do and if they do it well they win, if they do it badly, they lose.

Sure its nice to get a 'TY' when you flash in front of them to take a Cait ult for them, and yea its nice to give a 'GJ' to the assassin when he kills off the ADC, thats polite and its always nice to see, and i always do it to keep up team morale, but once you start expecting it, then you're getting full of yourself.
Never forget, as a support its your job to save them, if you DO save them, you are doing exactly what you're supposed to be doing, nothing more.

So don't expect the team to be grovelling on their knees saying _"Oh thank you Nami for doing the very thing your champion is supposed to be doing, you are the MVP!"_

I am a mid Mage main, but i play support a LOT. When i play mid, I try poke their team down as much as i can before the engage, and during the engage I try to keep my CC on the ADC and other key players. I don't do it for the 'GJ' i get afterwards, i do it so that my team can do their job properly and without having to worry about doing mine as well.  I Don't expect to be thanked for it, i just expect them to do their job.

When i play support, i dive in front of my ADC and sacrifice myself. not because i want a fucking medal for it, but because if i am alive and my ADC isn't, our team Is more disadvantaged than if the ADC was alive and i wasn't. and if they are more disadvantaged then they cant do their jobs as easily.

Be like a school of fish, move as one smooth body, as soon as one fish tries to be ahead of all the rest... They get eaten.

Dont get eaten.
hahahahaha this is savage asf and I love you for writing this (no homo)
The world is too PC. Sometimes a good slap in the face is the best thing for someone.
thats your job as the support.. don't need a thanks bcuz its expected from you to do ur Job, don't you think ? need a hug?
getting carried should be enough of a thankyou.
I believe in equality. I don't care about anybodies plays.
I get props for playing very well on support from time to time.

Same. I've actually made some really good genuine friends just because I was willing to die to protect my carries. Then there are the games when you literally kill it and carry the crucial team fights and everyone just leaves post lobby without saying a word like nothing happened. Just the way it goes.

I understand where you're coming from and I agree but.....you don't (or shouldn't) be doing it for the acknowledgement and or praise but purely for the love of you're role. It's frowned upon to not appreciate the hard work you're team mates put in when you get caught out or setting up kills but at the end of the day it's a common courtesy and nothing more.
